test-case.name: json-to-xml-014

modified.change: This test case was ported from the XSLT30 test suite

test-case.test: fn:json-to-xml('{"Key \" with quote":"Data with \" within it"}')//j:string

all-of.assert-xml: <string xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions" key="Key " with quote">Data with " within it</string>

test-case.name: json-to-xml-017b

modified.change: Added test related to bug issue 28997

test-case.test: import schema namespace j="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"; fn:json-to-xml('[1]', map{'validate':true()}) instance of document-node(schema-element(j:array))

test-case.name: json-to-xml-018
test-case.description: Duplicate entries in a map: default is to retain duplicates

test-case.name: json-to-xml-021
test-case.description: Character invalid in XML 1.0 in a string and a key: escape=true

modified.change: Revert previous change, see reopening of bug #28812

test-case.name: json-to-xml-022
test-case.description: Character invalid in XML 1.0 in a string and a key: escape=false

test-case.name: json-to-xml-025
test-case.description: Character invalid in XML 1.0 in a string and a key: fallback

modified.change: test and result corrections to actually use unescape=false
See bug 28946: this combination of options is now an error

test-case.name: json-to-xml-030
test-case.description: Exponent with upper-case E. Lexical representation retained, see bug 28179

test-case.name: json-to-xml-031
test-case.description: Exponent with lower-case E and sign; leading zero OK if followed by ".". Lexical representation retained, see bug 28179

test-case.name: json-to-xml-034
test-case.description: Zero-length keys and values are OK

test-case.name: json-to-xml-036
test-case.description: Duplicate entries in a map: duplicates=use-first

test-case.name: json-to-xml-037b
test-case.description: Validate a more complex example. Test created from json-to-xml-037 in accordance to bug 28997

modified.change: Added test case according to bug 28997

test-case.test: import schema namespace j="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"; (fn:json-to-xml('{"a":3, "b":true, "c":null, "d":[], "e":[1E2, ""], "f":{"1":true, "2":false}, "g\n":"h\n"}', map{'validate':true()})) instance of document-node(schema-element(Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions}map))

test-case.name: json-to-xml-038b

modified.change: Added test case according to bug 28997

test-case.test: import schema namespace j="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"; (fn:json-to-xml('{"a":3, "b":true, "c":null, "d":[], "e":[1E2, ""], "f":{"1":true, "2":false}, "g\n":"h\n"}', map{'validate':true(), 'escape':true()})) instance of document-node(schema-element(Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions}map))

test-case.name: json-to-xml-040
test-case.description: Duplicate entries in a map: use-first

modified.change: Result change (plus description edit), see bug #28998
Spec change, bug 29872, escaped characters retain their escaped form.
Revert previous change, see reopening of bug #28812

test-case.name: json-to-xml-043
test-case.description: Lower case hex digits are allowed

test-case.name: json-to-xml-044
json-to-xml-045

modified.change: Modified assertion to work in XPath as well as XQuery

test-case.name: json-to-xml-046
test-case.description: Validated map children (which should have anonymous type annotations)
test-case.test: import schema "http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"; let $json := ' { "a" : "foo", "b" : 123, "c" : null, "d" : true, "e" : false, "f" : [1], "g" : {} } ' let $xml := json-to-xml($json, map { 'validate' : true() })/fn:map return ( $xml/fn:string instance of element(fn:string, fn:stringType), $xml/fn:number instance of element(fn:number, fn:numberType), not($xml/fn:null instance of element(fn:null, fn:nullType)), $xml/fn:boolean instance of element(fn:boolean, fn:booleanType)+, $xml/fn:map instance of element(fn:map, fn:mapType), $xml/fn:array instance of element(fn:array, fn:arrayType) )

test-case.name: json-to-xml-047
test-case.description: Validated array children (which should have global type annotations)
test-case.test: import schema "http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"; let $json := '["foo",123,null,true,false,[],{}]' let $xml := json-to-xml($json, map { 'validate' : true() })/fn:array return ( $xml/fn:string instance of element(fn:string, fn:stringType), $xml/fn:number instance of element(fn:number, fn:numberType), $xml/fn:null instance of element(fn:null, fn:nullType), $xml/fn:boolean instance of element(fn:boolean, fn:booleanType)+, $xml/fn:map instance of element(fn:map, fn:mapType), $xml/fn:array instance of element(fn:array, fn:arrayType) )

modified.change: spec change, solidus is now escaped
spec change, bug29872, escape sequences in the input are retained unchanged
Revert previous change, see reopening of bug #28812
